intro: Facheiroa estevesii, commonly known as the Portuguese rose, is a rare and endemic species native to the Azores. It is a shrub-like plant characterized by its aromatic, pinkish-white flowers and dark green, glossy leaves. The plant thrives in humid, subtropical climates and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Its botanical features include small, oval-shaped leaves and a compact growth habit. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable species for botanical research and conservation efforts.
